body: I will merge this PR once the build passes. It looks fine now
@solomax @sebawagner all done in Arabic :-)
@sebawagner  banner is fixed :)
@ali-alhaidary merged :)

OK
After some debugging I find out the fact Java17 changes it's behavior :((((
We should remember it and change language file name after migrating to Java17

@sebawagner please use Java11 for import for now :(

Cool no worries. We can see, maybe create a Jenkins job for this tool?

Makes it easier for other devs to export the files.

Cheers
Seb

I'm usually visually check the diff
Long time ago there were some issues with placeholders, and some links
Not sure if this would be safe to automate :(
Hi @MOHAMADRV2007 it works as expected, where is the problem?
@MOHAMADRV2007 which XML are you referring to? :)
Assuming this replicates the same fix into embedded jetty build instructions I assume this should be fine, once Jenkins has validated the Pull Request.
Looks like org.postgresql:postgresql is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
Migrating as discussed in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-24127

Sry does this mean in the future articles on blogs.apache.org are published
via Github instead of the web interface at:
https://blogs.apache.org/roller-ui/ ?

Or is it just adding/exporting the existing blog articles into Github?

Thanks!
Seb

> Improve the mails (template) design #188

Hi Mr. @solomax, corrections made with images demo in the PR.
Thanks in advance.

Thanks for the contribution @geoffreylgv 

Updated version will be available at CI https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/OpenMeetings/job/openmeetings/ (in couple of hours)
and at demo server https://demo-openmeetings.apache.org/openmeetings (in about a day or so)
It is a real pleasure, thank you too; because, I learned a lot through this contribution.

Hello @yrt2023,
This error is due to missing `imagemagic` at your build machine
You should install it OR use additional `-PJenkins` (hopefully I spell it correctly ....)

Hi @solomax  ,

Thanks for the help . The Build is working now .
👍

I'm also getting the same issue even though I've installed the ImageMagic plugin as well.
is there any solution for me?

already added details in this issue:
https://github.com/apache/openmeetings/issues/193

Hello @nab95,

your first error is caused by absence of `ImageMagic` in the `${PATH}` you should install it, add it to the `${PATH}` or run with as `mvn clean install -PallModules,Jenkins`

other error is something new ...

Our CI build [1] as well as my local builds are green

I need some more info on your system:
 - What is you default locale?
 - What TZ are you in?

not sure what else can affect those tests :(

[1] https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/OpenMeetings/job/openmeetings/

Hi @solomax @nab95 
the error is so clear and obvious ;-)
@nab95 could you please also share which DB are you using?

Hi @solomax ,

The issue is resolved by adding Jenkins

Thank you very much.

Hello @WUZHUHE38 

It would be better to add some text description to your issue :)

In case you are trying to build current `master` branch it uses some `SNAPSHOT` dependencies

this particular `SNAPSHOT` is available here: 

https://oss.sonatype.org/service/local/repositories/snapshots/content/org/wicketstuff/wicketstuff-datastore-hazelcast/10.2.0-SNAPSHOT/

this repo is listed at `pom.xml` :)))
please re-open this issue with additional details if you feel additional help is needed :)

I have no issues building both locally and at our CI server
But both are Ubuntu

I'll try to reproduce it at Windows and will report back here :)

Just have tested

both 
 - CI build: https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/OpenMeetings/job/openmeetings/
 - and local Windows build

Are GREEN

Windows test box params:

```
  Win 10 Pro (all recent updates)
  Oracle JDK 17
  Maven 3.9.8

  mvn clean install -PJenkins,allModules
```

Please re-open with additional details if still an issue

Hello @WUZHUHE38,

Almost all UI screens are plain `HTML` ones the only exception is `Room UI` which uses no UI frameworks at the moment (more or less plain JS is used)
JQuery is part of Wicket so we are using it ...

Just curious: what would you like to optimize? look and feel? performance? :))
You are right. JQuery is the best choice in terms of performance. As for optimization, optimize the appearance, such as the appearance of Google Meet zoom.

for react/vue room related code need to be rewritten ...
I'm not sure `optimization` is the right word here :(

google-meet-like UI is currently available in room of type `interview`: no WB or screen-sharing so the UI is much simpler ....

I'm not sure how current UI can be optimized without loosing of functionality ...

Unfortunately current JS core is not documented :(

here is some info about it: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/OPENMEETINGS/OpenMeetings+HTML5+Session+Initialisation+and+Security
https://www.tiocloud.com/TioMeeting.pdf
UI Reference
Looks good :+1:
Thank you so much for the comments, I have made some updates accordingly, hope it is better this time :)
Many thanks for your contribution @Haoyu-Gao ! :)
